measured_by: Inclusion of Other in Self Scale
justification: The authors note that differences in perceived social distance can be "measured using social-distance related differences such as the Inclusion of Other in Self (Aron et al., 1992)."
They recommend "computational modeling such as Drift Diffusion Model (DDM, Ratcliff, 1978; Ratcliff et al., 2016) to disentangle the complex mental processes involved in dictator decision making."
construct: decision-making evidence accumulation / mental decision processes

justification: The review discusses findings related to "HEXACO Honesty-Humility (HH)"—explicitly tying the Honesty–Humility construct to the HEXACO personality framework that operationalizes it.

The paper reports that dictators "who showed stronger traits of Big Five Agreeableness… redistributed more money," indicating the Agreeableness construct was assessed within the Big Five measurement framework.
